title: Lima's Vibrant Heritage: Exploring the City's Landmarks Half-day
description: If you’re visiting Lima for the first time, orient yourself in Peru’s chaotic capital city with ease on a sightseeing tour that’s designed with first-time visitors in mind. As well as benefiting from the insider knowledge of a guide, you are transported between Lima’s top attractions in air-conditioned comfort.
all_descriptions: If you’re visiting Lima for the first time, orient yourself in Peru’s chaotic capital city with ease on a sightseeing tour that’s designed with first-time visitors in mind. As well as benefiting from the insider knowledge of a guide, you are transported between Lima’s top attractions in air-conditioned comfort.

Take in the many attractions found in the historic seaside city of Lima during this half-day sightseeing excursion. During your trip through this Peruvian capital, known to some as the “City of Kings,” you have a chance to view a range of historic architecture, unique cultural sights, and admire its gorgeous coastal landscape.

Start your day with either a morning or afternoon departure, receiving a pickup from your Lima hotel in Miraflores, San Isidro, or downtown. The first stop of the day is Lima’s historic city center, an area once known as the capital of the country’s colonial viceroyalty. Head next to the “Love Park,” a beautiful green space along the ocean-influenced by Barcelona architect Gaudí and featuring a sculpture by Peruvian artist Victor Delfín. 

Continue to San Isidro, a laid-back residential area of Lima. Drive past Huaca Pucllana for a glimpse of the ceremonial site, which pre-dates the arrival of the Spanish in the 16th century. Then head to Lima’s main square, where you’ll see the Municipal and Presidential Palaces, two sprawling structures whose size emphasizes their preeminence in the country’s political life. 

Proceed next to the Plaza de Armas to view the Lima Cathedral and stop by the tomb of Spanish conquistador Francisco Pizarro. You also swing by the Santo Domingo Convent, home to a sprawling monastery complex. 

Before finishing your Lima city visit, make additional stops at the Museum of Religious Art and the Church of Santo Domingo, the final resting place for the saints San Martin de Porres and Santa Rosa de Lima. At the end of your sightseeing adventure, receive a drop-off back at your Lima hotel.

marcella_piovano
Istanbul, Türkiye21 contributions

Peru is beautiful, but...

I make more than 5 important trips a year, so I think I can distinguish the mediocre organization from the good one. And in this 12-day trip the good level has not been there. The value for money was not the best. Little attention to customer/tourist needs. Skipped or changed visits at the last moment, little time for visits, but a lot of time spent for example shopping in agreed places. Poor hotels. I gave 3 bullets and not two because Peru is still beautiful.
Automatically translated
Written August 13, 2025

Graciela dos Santos
Gonzalez Catan, Argentina13 contributions

Peru 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

Thank you VIPAC for the excellent service. Attentive to every detail. They organized our trip from the time we arrived at the airport until we set out on our way back. They accompanied us in Lima and Cusco permanently. I would like to highlight the excellent experience we had with Rivelino, the best guide in the world😉. A real open book. Also thank David who took us to the Singrenacocha lagoon where we could meditate and connect with nature. What an experience!!!
I highly recommend them.🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
